paragraph: Tony Choy (born June 11, 1971) is a Cuban-American electric bassist. He was a session musician for some well-known technical death metal bands such as Atheist, Cynic and the Dutch band Pestilence.  He is known for his use of the Slap & Pop playing technique, along with two-handed tapping.
He was also the founding  member of the Grammy nominated Latin pop group named Area 305.
